instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message:
Hi Guys!
I just got another Board for fix and i need find out what happen with PP5V_S0 rail.
When i inject 5V on the rail the fan spinning
I don't get 1.1v in PPVCORE_S0_CPU.

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: History? Liquid?

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: Just stop one day.

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: Need more info. PPBUS at 12.6v? 3v3_s5 present? Green light?

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: Yes, i have both.

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: Come on man, give me some more info than that!

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H - 12.61
PP3V42_G3H - 3.42V (green Light)
PP5V_S0 - 0V
3v3_s5 - 3.33v
PP5V_S3 - 0V
PM_SLP_S4_L - 0V

- Resistance to ground in PP5V_S0 = 3.700K[COLOR=#666666][FONT=arial]Ω[/FONT][/COLOR]
- No light on the mouse
- When i inject 5v, the fan start spinning, but the CPU won't turn on (no hot)
- When i plug the battery, fun dont spinning, but CPU/VIDEO turn on (hot)
- Original Charge 85W

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER]

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: SMC_ADPAPTER_EN high?

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] SMC_ADAPTER_EN / Q7920 = 3.42v

Thank you

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: Check voltages after R1800,1,2,3. Check 32Khz on pin 12 of U2800.

threads.message:

About U2800, i can't bc i don't have oscilloscope.

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: Wait, when you plug in a battery the CPU/GPU get warm and these is no 5V_S0??

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: Is PLT_RESET_L stuck at 0v? Also, duke's question.

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: Yes, i Get 0V on PLT_RESET_L (U2890)

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: Like i said: I just get 5V_S0 when i plug the battery. Just charge, no.

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message:
I give up, this is what you said last week:

When i plug the battery, fun dont spinning, but CPU/VIDEO turn on (hot)

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message:
I keep saying :
When I connect the battery + charger the CPU and VIDEO get warm, also i dont have fan spinning.
Only charger , I do not get 5v also CPU and video.
I dont get 5V only from the charger.
That's why I'm here trying to learn from you how to find out .
I understand your engineer mood , but I 'm not here to learn how to "give up" in five steps , sorry .
U can help , just need more patience with anyone who is willing to learn something from you.

threads.title: 820-2914-b
threads.message: You are probably using a fake 85W charger so it will not power on from AC alone. If 5v_s0 is present the fans must spin.
